author: Michael Larabel
description: Debian Project Leader Andreas Tille announced today that their "FTP Master" team is being disbanded and instead establishing the Debian Archive Operations Team "Archive Team" and DFSG, Licensing  New Packages Team "DFSG Team" in its place...
title: Debian Establishes Archive Operations Team, Licensing & New Packages Team

author: Michael Larabel
description: The talented FFmpeg developers continue to be quite innovative with their performance optimizations and other features for this widely-used, open-source multimedia library. The latest addition to FFmpeg this weekend is introducing Vulkan accelerated video decoding for Apple ProRes content...
title: FFmpeg Introduces Vulkan Acceleration For Apple ProRes Video Decoding

author: Michael Larabel
description: Following the initial VFS changes last year for supporting block sizes larger than the kernel's page size along with the initial XFS file-system patches, Btrfs recently landed its support for block sizes greater than the page size. Now EXT4 is preparing to join the party too for allowing larger block sizes...
title: EXT4 Patches Enable Block Size Greater Than Page Size Support

author: Michael Larabel
description: As part of their Project Battlematrix effort, Intel has been working on enhancing their Linux graphics driver support for multi-device usage scenarios with wanting to support up to eight Intel Arc Pro graphics cards per system to help with AI LLMs and other larger use-cases. The latest code posted from Intel engineers is their initial implementation of multi-device Shared Virtual Memory (SVM) support...
title: Intel Sends Out Initial Graphics Driver Patches For Multi-Device SVM

author: Michael Larabel
description: Derek Clark who has been leading the efforts around Lenovo Legion gaming drivers for Linux and ensuring good support for the Lenovo Legion Go handheld on Linux sent out a new Linux patch series this weekend...
title: Linux Prepping For "Extreme" Mode On Lenovo Legion Devices
